item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is sorrow, there is holy ground." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you are not long, I will wait for you all my life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Misfortunes one can endure--they come from outside, they are accidents. But to suffer for one's own faults--ah!--there is the sting of life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One has a right to judge a man by the effect he has over his friends." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Millie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Millie add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Millie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Millie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Millie add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Millie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen
